Michigan Attorney General - Charitable Trust Section

incorporation_agency: Michigan Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs - Corporations, Securities & Commercial Licensing Bureau
charitable_registration_agency: Michigan Attorney General - Charitable Trust Section
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with contributions under $25,000 annually (or $25,000 in assets if non-soliciting) are generally exempt from charitable registration. Religious organizations and certain educational institutions are also exempt.

formation_requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs
formation_requirements.notes: Michigan requires a resident agent with a Michigan address. Filing fee of $20 is one of the lowest in the nation. Resident agent can be an individual or business entity.

requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs - Corporations Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due by October 1st each year for all corporations regardless of formation date
required_information: Names and addresses of directors and officers
requirements.notes: Michigan's annual statement is FREE with no filing fee or late penalties. Due October 1st for all entities. Failure to file for two consecutive years can result in administrative dissolution.

requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Attorney General - Charitable Trust Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Before soliciting contributions in Michigan (or within 30 days if soliciting threshold exceeded)
required_information: List of officers, directors, and trustees
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Registration is free and required for organizations soliciting in Michigan with contributions over $25,000. Organizations holding assets over $25,000 must also register even if not soliciting.

requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Attorney General - Charitable Trust Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 6 months after fiscal year end
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual filing is free with no late penalties. Organizations must file within 6 months of fiscal year end. Failure to file may result in investigation or enforcement action.

requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.form_number: Form 3372 - Michigan Sales and Use Tax Certificate of Exemption
requirements.notes: Michigan provides sales tax exemption for qualifying 501(c)(3) organizations on purchases for charitable purposes. Use Form 3372 to claim exemption. Not all purchases are exempt - review specific exemptions.

requirements.filing_agency: Local Tax Assessor and State Tax Commission
requirements.due_date_specifics: File annually by December 31st for following tax year (assessment date)
requirements.form_number: Form 5278 - Affidavit for Charitable Nonprofit Housing Exemption (and similar forms)
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
requirements.notes: Michigan property tax exemption requires exclusive charitable use. Different exemption statutes apply to different types of charitable property (housing, education, etc.). Annual affidavit required. Contact local assessor for specific forms and requirements.

requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Gaming Control Board - Charitable Gaming Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for calendar year; renew annually
requirements.form_number: License Application for Small and Large Raffle
required_information: Proof of incorporation or organization in Michigan
requirements.notes: Michigan allows raffles, bingo, and charitable gaming for qualified nonprofits in existence for 5+ years. Small raffles (under $5,000 aggregate prizes) and large raffles have different requirements. Municipality must approve gaming activities.

requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Gaming Control Board - Charitable Gaming Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for calendar year; renew annually
required_information: List of officers and bingo managers
requirements.notes: Bingo license required for regular bingo operations. Organization must be in existence for 5+ years. Quarterly reporting required. Strict rules on prize amounts and operations apply.

requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Attorney General - Charitable Trust Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
required_information: List of current Michigan charity clients
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional fundraisers who solicit on behalf of charities. Registration is free but bond is required. Each contract must be filed within 10 days. Annual campaign reports required.

requirements.filing_agency: Michigan Attorney General - Charitable Trust Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Fundraising counsel provides consulting but does not solicit or handle contributions. Registration is free and no bond is required. Each contract must be filed within 10 days.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and included in annual report if required
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 180 days after fiscal year end (completed before annual renewal)
requirements.notes: Michigan requires audited financial statements for organizations with gross receipts over $500,000. Organizations between $200,000-$500,000 should have financial review. Organizations under $200,000 may file internally prepared statements. Audit must be performed by independent CPA licensed in Michigan.

special_notes.free_filings: Michigan is exceptionally nonprofit-friendly with free charitable registration, free annual reports (both corporate and charitable), and no late fees. Initial incorporation fee of $20 is among the lowest nationally.
special_notes.dual_threshold: Michigan registration is triggered by either $25,000 in contributions (if soliciting) OR $25,000 in assets (even if not soliciting). This dual threshold is unusual.
special_notes.board_requirements: Michigan nonprofit corporations must have at least three directors. Directors need not be Michigan residents. Board must comply with bylaws and fiduciary duties.
special_notes.five_year_gaming_rule: Organizations must be in continuous operation for 5 years before conducting charitable gaming. This is standard but represents a barrier for newer nonprofits.
special_notes.gaming_control_board: Michigan has a dedicated Gaming Control Board that oversees all charitable gaming including raffles and bingo. Regulations are comprehensive and strictly enforced.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying. Michigan law reinforces these federal limits.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_free: Professional fundraiser and fundraising counsel registration is free in Michigan, unlike most states that charge significant fees. Bond still required for fundraisers.
special_notes.audit_threshold: Michigan audit threshold is $500,000 in gross receipts, which is mid-range. Review threshold is $200,000.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes. Attorney General must be notified and may need to approve dissolution plans.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T and Michigan Corporate Income Tax Return (Form 4891) if conducting business in Michigan.
special_notes.property_tax_annual_filing: Michigan requires annual affidavits for property tax exemption, unlike some states where exemption is perpetual once granted. This adds administrative burden.
special_notes.october_corporate_deadline: All Michigan corporations must file annual statements by October 1st regardless of formation or fiscal year end date. This is unusual and different from most states.
special_notes.charitable_trust_assets: Organizations holding charitable assets in trust form have additional reporting requirements beyond standard charitable organization registration.
